newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore bunker weak despite berth congestion.
newsitem.headline: Singapore bunker weak despite berth congestion.

text.p: Despite continued berth congestion, some Singapore bunker suppliers lowered offers $2.00 per tonne on Thursday to attract shipowners, traders said.
Even majors cut offers to try to get at least one deal, ignoring the already low spread of $2-$3 per tonne between cargo and bunker levels, traders said.
"It's better than nothing. After the first deal, they raise the offer slightly," said one supplier.
The 380-cst grade was quoted at $94/$97 per tonne. MDO and gas oil were quoted lower to around $185 and $195 respectively. -- Singapore Newsroom (65 8703571)
